page.title: 01 Town meets Country
page.content: Fifty years ago the town was just beginning its spread into the green fields. Cottingham village alone is the built up zone in the survey block with any history older than that. Even today there is a tenuous {green belt}around the village broken only by the thin ribbons of high class housing which stretch along the main road links to Hull. In the 1930s and again in the 1960s and 1970s planned council estates sprawled over the rich pastures of the river Hull floodplain. Only four years ago the earthmovers were back eating up hundreds more acres to lay down a by-pass road, easing the traffic problems of Beverley, a small market town 5 miles to the north. Old and new suburban Hull meets the green of the hay fields, and the brown and gold of the corn fields struggling to survive.
